sen.e: The Empress Teimei said to the Empress Kojun, '(Whenever I ask you to do something) you are always disgraceful,' and then the Empress Kojun could not say any words to her remaining silent.

sen.j: 頭脳明敏で気丈な性格の貞明皇后ではあったが、目下の者にも決して直接叱責することはなかった。
sen.e: The Empress Teimei was bright and intelligent and had a courageous character, but she never scolded her subordinates directly.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Empress Teimei was bright, intelligent and courageous, but she never scolded her subordinates directly.
sen.cmt: 文章前半の接続詞の使い方の修正とともに、表現を少し修正しました。（形容詞が並列になるよう修正しました。）
sen.e: The Empress Teimei was bright, intelligent and courageous, but she never scolded her subordinates directly.

sen.j: それで、この一件を目の前にした女官たちに、二人は嫁姑として全くうまくいってないと知らしめる結果になってしまった。
sen.e: Therefore, those court ladies who witnessed this incidents demonstrated action understood it to be the usual frictions between a young wife and her mother-in-law, and an example supporting the fact of their strained relationship.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Therefore, those court ladies who witnessed this incident understood they had never got along well as a wife and her mother-in-law.
sen.cmt: demonstrated action を削除しました。Incidentsは単数形にしました。後半の文章は英訳の意味がよく読み取れず、別の表現に修正をしました。
sen.e: Therefore, those court ladies who witnessed this incident understood they had never got along well as a wife and her mother-in-law.

sen.j: 一方で弟宮の嫁達、秩父宮、高松宮、三笠宮の妃たちとは御所での食事や茶会を度々招いて、かわいがったそうである。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Empress Teimei loved the princesses (wives) of the younger brothers of the Emperor Showa, 'Chichibu no Miya,' 'Takamatsu no Miya,' and 'Mikasa no Miya' enough to invite them for dinners and tea parties at the Imperial palace.

On the other hand, the Empress Teimei loved the princesses (wives) of the younger brothers of the Emperor Showa, Chichibu no Miya, Takamatsu no Miya, and Mikasa no Miya enough to invite them very frequently for dinners and tea parties at the Imperial palace.
sen.cmt: 全角、かつ不要な引用符を削除しました。「度々」が訳抜けのため、追記しました。
sen.e: On the other hand, the Empress Teimei loved the princesses (wives) of the younger brothers of the Emperor Showa, Chichibu no Miya, Takamatsu no Miya, and Mikasa no Miya enough to invite them very frequently for dinners and tea parties at the Imperial palace.

sen.j: 特に次男・秩父宮の妃であった雍仁親王妃勢津子はお気に入りであったらしく、お互い親交が深かった。
sen.e: Especially, the Empress Teimei seemed to favor the Imperial Princess Chichibu Setsuko, who was the wife of her second son, 'Chichibu no Miya, and had an intimate relationship with her.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Especially, the Empress Teimei seemed to favor the Imperial Princess Chichibu Setsuko, who was the wife of her second son, Chichibu no Miya, and had an intimate relationship with her.
sen.cmt: 全角、かつ不要な引用符を削除しました。
sen.e: Especially, the Empress Teimei seemed to favor the Imperial Princess Chichibu Setsuko, who was the wife of her second son, Chichibu no Miya, and had an intimate relationship with her.

sen.j: 毎年3月3日の桃の節句の折には勢津子が実家からお輿入れした際持ち込んだ雛人形を宮邸に飾った。
sen.e: On every year of the Peach Festival (also known as the Girls' Festival) on March third, Setsuko displayed the hina dolls (dolls displayed at the Girls' Festival), which she brought with her from her family home when she married into the Imperial family, in the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: On the Peach Festival (also known as the Girls' Festival) celebrated every year on March 3, Setsuko displayed the hina dolls (dolls displayed at the Girls' Festival), which she brought with her from her family home when she married into the Imperial family, in the Imperial Palace.
sen.cmt: every yearの位置が誤っているため変更し、それにあわせて補記しました。日付の表記を統一しました。
sen.e: On the Peach Festival (also known as the Girls' Festival) celebrated every year on March 3, Setsuko displayed the hina dolls (dolls displayed at the Girls' Festival), which she brought with her from her family home when she married into the Imperial family, in the Imperial Palace.

sen.j: それを、貞明皇后に見てもらうのが恒例行事であったそうである。
sen.e: Then, Setsuko showed the display to the Empress Teimei as was in keeping with the established practice rites.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: It was an annual event that Setsuko showed the display to the Empress Teimei.
sen.cmt: 後半の意味が読み取れないため、文章全体を修正しました。
sen.e: It was an annual event that Setsuko showed the display to the Empress Teimei.

sen.j: 勢津子は自身の著書『銀のボンボニエール』において、そのことを「お子様4人全員が親王様（男子）であったので、毎年お楽しみにされているのでしょう」と語っている。
sen.e: In her published book, "The Silver Bonbonniere (French word: A small, ornate box or dish for candy)," Setsuko wrote on this Peach Festival Event, "The Empress Teimei having four children and all are Imperial princes (sons), so she seems to look forward to the Peach Festival with pleasure."

In her published book, "The Silver Bonbonniere (French word: A small, ornate box or dish for candy)," Setsuko wrote on this Peach Festival event, 'The Empress Teimei had four children who are all Imperial princes (boys), so she seems to look forward to the Peach Festival with pleasure.'
sen.cmt: Eventは小文字に修正しました。引用符を半角へ修正、二重引用符を引用符へ修正しました。「お子様の・・・」の中の文構造を意味がとりやすく修正しました。
sen.e: In her published book, "The Silver Bonbonniere (French word: A small, ornate box or dish for candy)," Setsuko wrote on this Peach Festival event, 'The Empress Teimei had four children who are all Imperial princes (boys), so she seems to look forward to the Peach Festival with pleasure.'

sen.j: 女官制度の廃止など宮廷改革を進めた長男の昭和天皇に反発した。
sen.e: The Empress Teimei was offended by her oldest son, the Emperor Showa, since he progressed with the reform of the Imperial Court, such as the abolishment of the court lady system.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: The Empress Teimei rebelled against her oldest son, the Emperor Showa, since he progressed the reform of the Imperial Court, such as the abolishment of the court lady system.
sen.cmt: 「反発した」の部分が文法ミスのため、単語もあわせて修正しました。Withが不要なため削除しました。
sen.e: The Empress Teimei rebelled against her oldest son, the Emperor Showa, since he progressed the reform of the Imperial Court, such as the abolishment of the court lady system.

sen.j: それで、自身の大宮御所では旧態依然とした宮廷制度を維持した。
sen.e: Thus, in reaction, the Empress Teimei kept the traditional Imperial Court system as was, and so it remained unchanged within her Omiya Gosho (the Omiya Imperial Palace).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Thus, in reaction, the Empress Teimei kept the traditional and outdated Imperial Court system within her own Omiya Gosho (the Omiya Imperial Palace).
sen.cmt: 意味が重複している部分があったので、修正しました。「旧態依然とした」はoutdatedに修正しました。
sen.e: Thus, in reaction, the Empress Teimei kept the traditional and outdated Imperial Court system within her own Omiya Gosho (the Omiya Imperial Palace).

sen.j: とはいえ決して昭和天皇との関係は悪くなかった。
sen.e: Nevertheless, the Empress Teimei and the Emperor Showa had a decent relationship.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Nevertheless, the Empress Teimei and the Emperor Showa had a decent relationship.
Nevertheless, the Empress Teimei and the Emperor Showa had a decent relationship.

sen.j: 皇居内で見かけた鳥の名前について子供染みた我の張り合いをしたというほほえましいエピソードもある。
sen.e: There was a heartwarming episode of their (mother and son) argument over the name of a bird they had seen at the Imperial Place, as if they were children.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: There was a heartwarming episode of their (mother and son) argument over the name of a bird they had seen at the Imperial Place, as if they were children.
There was a heartwarming episode of their (mother and son) argument over the name of a bird they had seen at the Imperial Place, as if they were children.

sen.j: また第二次大戦時においては、戦況の悪化の中でも疎開を拒む母を気遣った。
sen.e: Additionally during the World War II, the Emperor Showa worried about his mother (the Empress Teimei) who refused to evacuate from the Tokyo area when the war condition worsened.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: Additionally, during the World War II, the Emperor Showa worried about his mother (the Empress Teimei) who refused to evacuate from the Tokyo area when the war condition worsened.
sen.cmt: Additionallyのあとにカンマを追記しました。
sen.e: Additionally, during the World War II, the Emperor Showa worried about his mother (the Empress Teimei) who refused to evacuate from the Tokyo area when the war condition worsened.

sen.j: そのことが、昭和天皇が最後まで東京を離れなかった一因ともされる。
sen.e: So, this concern for his mother was considered to be the one of factors for the Emperor Showa to remain in, and never leaving Tokyo.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文例外対処
sen.e: So, this concern for his mother was considered to be the one of factors for the Emperor Showa to remain in, and never leaving Tokyo.
So, this concern for his mother was considered to be the one of factors for the Emperor Showa to remain in, and never leaving Tokyo.

sen.j: しかし皇后の愛情は、次男の秩父宮に傾きがちであったと囁かれる。
sen.e: However, the people surrounded the Empress Teimei expressed the belief that the Empress Teimei tended to love her second son, Chichibu no Miya.
However, the people who surrounded the Empress Teimei expressed the belief that the Empress Teimei tended to love her second son, 'Chichibu no Miya.'
sen.cmt: 関係代名詞whoを追記しました。（文法ミス）不要な引用符（かつ全角）を削除しました。
sen.e: However, the people who surrounded the Empress Teimei expressed the belief that the Empress Teimei tended to love her second son, 'Chichibu no Miya.'

sen.j: 彼女と宮の誕生日は同じであり、そのことから皇后は強い縁を感じていたとも言われる。
sen.e: Because the Empress Teimei and 'Chichibu no Miya' had the same birth day, the Empress Teimei seemed to strongly sense a shared fate with him.
Because the Empress Teimei and Chichibu no Miya share the same birthday, the Empress Teimei seemed to strongly sense a shared fate with him.

sen.e: Because the Empress Teimei and Chichibu no Miya share the same birthday, the Empress Teimei seemed to strongly sense a shared fate with him.

sen.j: 上記の秩父宮の婚姻に関しても、妃に朝敵・松平容保の孫でなおかつ平民である勢津子を強く推したのは貞明皇后であったと言われる。
sen.e: Regarding the marriage of 'Chichibu no Miya,' the Empress Teimei strongly recommended Setsuko as his princess; she was a grand daughter of the Emperor's enemy, Katamori MATSUDAIRA, and also a Heimin (commoner).

sen.e: Regarding the marriage of Chichibu no Miya mentioned above, it is said that the Empress Teimei strongly recommended Setsuko as his princess; she was a grand daughter of the Emperor's enemy, Katamori MATSUDAIRA, and also a Heimin (commoner).

sen.e: The people who knew well of the inner workings inside the Imperial court, expressed that the Empress Teimei contributed greatly, through her efforts, toward the successful marriage of Setsuko and 'Chichibu no Miya' (Toshiaki KAWAHARA).
